Review.Contenu: I’ve installed the trial version of Parallels for Mac. It looks good in general and I was considering buying a $99 license. However, during checkout I’ve come across a price manipulation. After entering details and turning to checkout I got a price which is ~35% higher than the one placed on the main website. Moreover, it is converted by default to my local currency. It seems that this is made intentionally, looking for the people who won’t notice price difference. The most interesting that Parallels support told that this difference is related to VAT and is determined by my location. But the thing is that VAT in my country is 20%, not 35%.All in all, this looks like a marketing trick or price fraud. And I will have to search for alternatives.-------UPDATE:We've discussed the matter with Parallels Team. It turned out that increase over $99 original price tag is applicable only to non-US customers and is established by Parallel's payment processing partner. Such increase consists of two parts:– VAT being individually calculated depending on client's location– Currency conversion fees that are calculated by payment processing partnerThe second item is quite interesting because even if I turn off conversion to my local currency at the checkout, it still shows increased price in USD.And it still looks really unusual when VAT is claimed to be individual across different locations. I've purchased quite a lot of software licenses online and this pricing case looks strange.All in all, my final price is still $135 which makes the product less attractive.

Review.Titre: Efficient and dedicated technical support; deceptive headquarters website
Review.Contenu: Parallels customer support was able to solve the installation problem of updates on Mac with OS Monterey through a remote session. I was impressed by the skill and friendliness of the Parallels expert. He and his colleagues followed closely the functionality of Parallels on my desktop. At the same time, criticize the conduct of the company's headquarters as displayed on its website. It shows a telephone number for contact and provides a form to submit feedback. Neither work. This is a deliberate deception and a blatant disrespect of customers.

Review.Titre: I wanted to use Rocky Linux.
Review.Contenu: The user mentioned that they were extremely disappointed that they couldn't use Red Hat-based Linux distributions like CentOS or Rocky Linux, even though they had a great user experience. They requested a refund for their current purchase because it didn't suit their needs, but mentioned that they would consider buying again if support for those distributions became available. Here's the English translation:"The user's experience was fantastic in terms of usability, but it's incredibly disappointing that Red Hat-based Linux distributions like CentOS or Rocky Linux are not supported. They were able to obtain a refund for their current purchase since it didn't align with their usage requirements. However, they mentioned that they would definitely consider making a purchase in the future if these distributions become compatible."

Review.Titre: Parallels is an excellent product
Review.Contenu: Parallels is an excellent product, and it really functions well with responsive performance, but with one little snag you need to be aware of.....The KEYBOARD LAYOUT changes subtly in the password screen... so some special charatcers are not in the expected positions.  They are in the username screen, but then it changes.  Took me ages to find this....

Review.Titre: i find it useful
Review.Contenu: i find it useful, yet i believe there is room for improvement  spatially for support of older os with apple M chips. also regarding ease of use and stability.

Review.Titre: Easy to install and great in Coherence mode
Review.Contenu: Easy to install.Great to work in Coherence mode.I have 3 permanent versions: 15,16 and 18.18 in the first computer, OK16 didn’t work in Coherece mode in the second Mac; problem with support; couldn’t get info to operate version 16 in Coherence mode. Had to downgrade to15 and it is OK.

Review.Titre: The best product on the market (if you can afford it)
Review.Contenu: The best product on the market, but too commercial. The super high technical standards of the product are countered by senseless limitations to processor numbers and available RAM. Parallels could have made much more money by being more generous (like Microsoft did in the past).

Review.Titre: The best addition to my MacBook
Review.Contenu: The absolute best addition to my MacBook Pro. Seamless transition between IOS and windows expands flexibility to support your business and client as well. The only downside, it dominates available disk space with an unnecessary amount of cache.

Review.Titre: As a newcomer to Parallels
Review.Contenu: As a newcomer to Parallels, I have a lot to learn about the numerous features that this suite of software offers, providing a wide range of unique possibilities. My goal is to acquire sufficient knowledge of the relevant functions to enable the use of 32-bit legacy software on a Macintosh while running the latest macOS systems

Review.Titre: What made my experience great with…
Review.Contenu: What made my experience great with parallels desktop is the easy to use software to access windows on a Mac. It is great for people who have an Mac so that they can use software not compatible with macs even access those software, such as in my case I had a Mac, but needed a software named Autodesk Inventor 2023 for school, and so via parallels desktop I could easily access that software. I wish there was improvement and I know many people, more likely students, want this which is the price, students studying in high school really can’t afford 129 $ per year, there shouldn’t be a price, or should be a lesser price for students.

Review.Contenu: issues with virtual serial port.After upgrading from parallels 17 to 18 i lost the ability to use a used serial connector for example (connect to a switch/router).

Review.Titre: Good virtualization software
Review.Contenu: A good solution solution to use different versions of several Op Sys at the same time.

Review.Contenu: I can't use Xbox app and log in Microsoft account on UWP Apps. My device is MacBook Air M2(2022)

Review.Contenu: Sometimes lose focus on active Parallel desktop windows. Need to select target Windows from Parallel Windows menu.

Review.Contenu: Adobe CS6 is working on virtual Sierra and Windows 10 in this last Parallels.

Review.Titre: Works way better than previous…
Review.Contenu: Works way better than previous versions. Not perfect but close.

Review.Titre: it is really easy to use
Review.Contenu: it is really easy to use, really usability oriented

Review.Titre: I have chance to get discount
Review.Contenu: I have chance to get discount, but not applied.

Review.Titre: Parallels was able to run almost all of…
Review.Contenu: Parallels was able to run almost all of my structural engineering softwares

Review.Titre: Performant and powerful virtualization
Review.Contenu: As a long term Windows user it was difficult for me to switch to MacOS, mainly that for my job I use a lot of Windows only applications. Parallels is really a life saver. The application virtualizes the OS and is very performant. In my personal opinion even faster than VMware Fusion. The interoperability with hardware from the host system is very good and the ability to share files from Windows to Mac and vice-versa is a very welcome feature.Doing a good job! No regrets from this purchase!

Review.Titre: Parallels is the best Windows-on-a-Mac Tool.
Review.Contenu: Parallels is the best Windows emulation for the Mac. My new M1-based MacBook AIR required a new version of Parallels and an upgrade from Windows 10 to Windows 11 (preview). Things are working perfectly. I'm still not 100% clear on Confluence or Transparency modes, but as a Windows-on-a-Mac solution, Parallels has never let me down.

Review.Titre: Mac user addicted to Windows Version of Quicken.
Review.Contenu: I am am part of the Apple environment and use a Mac as my personal computer.  I very much prefer the Windows version of Quicken over the Mac version (having tried both).  Parallels provides a reliable way to run Windows on my Mac and with the newest version it is quite stable.  Quicken for Windows on a Mac is a winner thanks to Parallels.

Review.Titre: Parallels generally meets my…
Review.Contenu: Parallels generally meets my expectations.  I’m running a Mac Mini M1 (ARM processor) with Mac OS Monterey and Windows 11 (Insiders Beta).  Windows is installed on an external NVME drive.  The only real problem that I have experienced is that I cannot get windows to properly recognize serial data through a USB 2 connection (i.e., a serial GPS receiver).  Mac OS sees it just fine, Windows will not. I sure hope that this issue is resolved with future updates of Parallels and/or Windows.

Review.Titre: eject usb
Review.Contenu: I am having great difficulty seeing and ejecting a usb device when using parallels. Following the instructions did not bring the required icon to the task bar. Double clicking does not bring eject to the menu options list. Manage devices does not allow selection of eject. Extremely frustrating and time wasting.

Review.Titre: Does what it says on the can!
Review.Contenu: As far as I can see Parallels does what it promises effectively and efficiently. Windows 11 loads very quickly from cold and allows me to run legacy software from years ago before I migrated to my Mac whilst allowing seamless copy and paste from Mac programs into Windows. There’s nothing this aged experienced amateur would like to do that Parallels prevents or makes difficult. There are many advanced features in Parallels that I don’t understand nor have need for, hence the 4 stars rather than 5.

Review.Titre: Parallels: great piece of software
Review.Contenu: I think Parallels is a *great piece* of Software!Being still a novice user, I feel I really need this S/W, because of my age I still am dependent on Windows due to the many years I worked with Windows en many applications in that operating system.On the other hand I love the design and the smoothness of iMac and Apple software.So Parallels is my ideal companion.Once I am an experienced user I am confident in giving it 5 stars *****

Review.Titre: I can't give you 5 stars because the…
Review.Contenu: I can't give you 5 stars because the Native Instruments for Windowssoftware I need will not run on a virtual machine! Other than that, I am very pleased with how well Parallels 15 is able to run Windows 10 Professional on my 2011 17" MacBook Pro which is loaded with macOS Sierra.Now I just am awaiting support from Parallels in order to load High Sierra into its own place on my computer - then I think I will be able to run the Native Instruments software I need.

Review.Titre: Check this!
Review.Contenu: I do all my work on Mac, with one exception : I need some Outlook functionalities that are only available in the Outlook Windows-version.Parallels allowed me to install Office on the Windows side of my Mac and switch between the two platforms very easily.All application function very fast and the installation was plug& play.Great product!

Review.Titre: Parallels just made my MacBook Pro run…
Review.Contenu: Parallels just made my MacBook Pro run like a windows as I use it for trading using mt4 charts and it’s very smooth but only problem is when you buy full version of parallels I can’t use parallel tools which comes handy sometimes it would be great if this comes free with full version

Review.Titre: This works exceptionally well on a new…
Review.Contenu: This works exceptionally well on a new M1 MacBook with latest Windows arm release. Only issue I have found so far is that some of of our legacy in house programs crash but I have an early version that works fine. I am happy to be able to run the few Windows programs I need on a  Mac rather than questionably reliable Windows laptops.

Review.Titre: Effective and reliable.
Review.Contenu: I use Parallels chiefly for tax/financial apps not published for MacOS, and legacy gear with no Mac drivers. It works flawlessly. If I made more rigorous use of it, I’d consider 5 stars, but I really don’t drive it hard enough to evaluate it at that level. And each release, I’ve notices, has improved performance and features implementation.

Review.Titre: Great support and innovation
Review.Contenu: Great support and innovation. Over time, has become faster, more reliable and quicker to support new technologies than Fusion; great support of M1x and Windows 11, great Interface. I just wish the Pro version was offered - for a higher price - without a subscription.

Review.Titre: It worked well!
Review.Contenu: It worked well! Bearing in mind what I was using was a beta. I am very interested in purchasing the finished product for my M1 Mac based on that experience. I hear that it is something like 30% faster now than the beta. If that is the case, I may adjust my rating to five stars once I have verified that.

Review.Titre: Great way to use multiple operating systems
Review.Contenu: Parallels puts as many virtual computers on your physical computer that you may ever need. Very easy to use and comes with a few versions of Windows and Linux to get you started. I do wish they would have created a OS/2 Warp 4 virtual machine, but hopefully that i somewhere down the line in development for Parallels.

Review.Titre: Good, but still a challenge for many Windows games.
Review.Contenu: Parallels has been a goto for a decent VM with above average performance on the Mac Platform.  With recent changes in the Mac environment, it's now a must have for using 32 bit apps or games.  This version still struggles but has made progress.  Hopefully the improvements in the new version build on its current progress.

Review.Titre: Responsive and user friendly + Cleaner scan question?
Review.Contenu: Hello, Anyone using the Cleaner scan? It wants permission to quite a few things in Security preferences and it bit worrying.I am a new comer to Parallels after using Virtualbox and Bootcamp and it is so much easier to use. I test software installations in my role at work and create user guides and documentation. I was concerned it might be really slow but it is pretty responsive. All the best!

Review.Titre: The program is wonderful, but!
Review.Contenu: The program is wonderful, loads fast. The only problem I have encountered is the keyboard mapping. For instance I can't do fractions because I cannot use the slash key and the delete key works but I have to put the curser before the word and delete forward. I tried to fix it, I'm sure there must be a way but you would think I wouldn't have to.

Review.Titre: It works flawlessly 👏
the choice of excellence
Review.Contenu: Parralles Desktop is the choice of excellence. Packed with features. The only flaw is that you press Ctrl+C and Ctrl + V (Classic Copy and Paste), instead of performing the paste action, it writes the letter "V". So you have to Ctrl + C first, release Ctrl, press Ctrl + V again, a big hassle. If the problem is overcome in configuration, this option has been made inconspicuous. In other words, the sequenced keyboard commands are not handled correctly.

Review.Titre: We swapped to Mac company-wide
Review.Contenu: We swapped to Mac company-wide; one of the programs I use for work needs windows.  It helps out a lot.  There are a few issues every once and a while.  It freezes up and has to restart the program.

Review.Titre: Parallels Is Great
Review.Contenu: Moving to a Mac, I know I would lose some Windows only apps. I didn't know how much I would need these Windows apps as being a programmer. Because I couldn't use these apps, I would carry 2 laptops, until I found VM software. At first I tried VMWare, and it didnt work the way I wanted it to. Then, I found Parallels. It was easy to install and had great performance. It saved me alot of stress because my Mac and Windows files would be synced across both platforms (and my back thanks me as well).

Review.Titre: Path for Gradual Migrations ...
Review.Contenu: Parallels is a great way to gradually migrate from one computer to another. I've used it to ensure everything on my old XP machine was captured on my Mac. And now with potential loss of older video formats when updating to Catalina, I have a virtual Mojave machine to fall back on if I find a non-converted file.

Review.Titre: Better than other options
Review.Contenu: Parallels allows me to run multiple OS’s in a VM easily. I’ve tried a couple of other options and Parallels is just plain easier. I maintain VM’s for Win10, Win98, Win3.11, OS/2 and Linux. So much easier and cheaper than trying to maintain all these on separate machines.

Review.Titre: Everything works well
Review.Contenu: Everything works well, thanx

Review.Titre: ARM limitations are a nuisance
Review.Contenu: For normal use I find Parallels an excellent piece of software. It would be great, though, if one day it will be possible to run Visual Studio (I use C#) and actually code and compile from Windows running in Parallels.

Review.Titre: Capable hypervisor, restrictive licensing.
Review.Contenu: Elegant, capable hypervisor that's also more tolerant of running on older hardware.The only thing letting it down (still!) is the inflexible single seat license model vs. VMware Fusion allowing you to install the same licence on multiple Macs owned by you.

Review.Titre: I have done downloading but cant share…
Review.Contenu: I have done downloading but cant share my macbook the error msg is "To be able to change the setting on this page, resume the virtual machine and then shut down."how to solve this problem please?appreciate your fast reply

Review.Titre: Works great.....
Review.Contenu: Works great...... would have been 5 stars if sound and networking worked on a Windows 98 VM. But it does work good enough to send programs through a USB connected IR device to a Lego Mindstorms RCX 2.0 controller. My grandson is thrilled.

Review.Titre: Using Parallels on an M1 MacbookPro
Review.Contenu: I just purchased an M1 MacbookPro. While it was more complicated to set up Parallels and an M1 version of Windows, I eventually was able to set it up and it runs better than it did on my old Intel Mac. Keep up the good work.

Review.Titre: Registration was a bit tough
Review.Contenu: Registration was a bit tough.  Had to find a previous version of parallels to register which was not on the account I used when I purchased this one.  Luckily I was able to locate the previous version on another account I used prior.

Review.Titre: I don’t use Parallels Tools but Desktop…
Review.Contenu: I don’t use Parallels Tools but Desktop enables me to run Windows 10 in order to use PC version on my MacBook Pro.  When I had to have my MacBook Pro repaired it was returned in condition I couldn’t log onto Windows, and had to contact Parallels Support.... pain in the behind because Parallels website doesn’t make it easy to find out how to do that!  I didn’t have the Parallels “key” in order to restore the version of Parallels.  Took over 4-hours!  Finally got a nice lady who sounded like she was in a foreign call center, she coached how to allow her remote access to my laptop then she restored the “key” and all was well! So make it EASIER to know how to contact Parallels Support.

Review.Titre: merging mode is wonderful!
I wish that the Parallels ran without having windows 10 in bootcamp
Review.Contenu: I wish that the Parallels didn't still use my boot camp and the windows program ran directly in Parallels so i could get rid of my windows software. Otherwise Parallels works great

Review.Titre: I am still understanding the package…
Review.Contenu: Actually I am still understanding the facilities that this package provides however the Microsoft Word facility seems to lack a number of the important features that I use.

Review.Titre: Great software and was very easy to set…

Apps usually work smoothly but sometimes during writing in Word, the app stops for about 3-5 seconds and I am losing a track of my thoughts during lectures on Teams. For me, the biggest minus is the fact that permanent version of Parallels Desktop allows you to use just 4 CPU (out of 12 I have on my MacPro) and 8 GB of RAM (out of 128) so I can't use the whole potential of my PC. I know that if I had chosen a one-year subscription I could use the full power of my computer, but I dislike paying for an app every year. I would give it 5 stars if they made a permanent version which would have allowed me to use the whole potential of my computer.

Review.Titre: I like the VM a lot, but I'm learning to live with some of
Review.Contenu: The installation of the Parallels program was straight forward.  I needed a VM environment on my new iMac using Catalina OS to house an old "2007 Quicken for Mac" program in an El Capitan OS.  I did not want to abandon 16 years of data to try to fit into (or misfit) the latest Quicken App.  I found that on the whole, it is doing what I need to continue to add data to the App.  I'm living with some peculiar issues such as that I no longer be able to use Quicken's native backup.  Every time I do, I lose recently entered data.  I conclude after working with Quicken experts that it might be a Quicken problem that they no longer support.  So I just rely on Disk backup on the Mac.  Hoping that is adequate.  Then there is the issue of shutting down Parallels.  I found that if I shut down the VM, I will lose data in Quicken as well.  So I must do no more than  minimize or suspend Parallels, when I turn off the computer.  It give me pause when recently Parallels offers an update.  Should I shut down the VM and risk losing data for the update?  I'm learning to live with the corkiness of the situation.  By the way, their tech support is great, very responsive and knowledgable.

Review.Contenu: I've been using Parallels on my MAC for years. Additionally, it helps keep me somewhat current on Windows, which is what the majority of people use.  It's incredible, though, how quickly you forget Windows, so for me it having it on my Mac serves two useful purposes.  Staying current with Windows and keeping my Access database files current without using two PCs.

Review.Titre: Impressing.
Review.Contenu: seamless integration of windows into mac os. you can open files in windows with macOS programs seamless per double click and vice versa. If you dont want to, you won't see the windows interface again after installation, just your programs whats very useful for working productively. You can move Windows OS - windows over macOS windows and vice versa seamless and won't experience any lags or other. Also the windows system is faster than my old windows laptop. Windows will boot in a few seconds in the background automatically after starting -any- program or file which is associated to an windows program.As an mechanic and software engineer i have to say that i'm more than impressed of this Software (Parallels Desktop). It's rarely that i'm improved by user friendly design.

Review.Titre: Parallels (currently on my macbook pro - the perfect seamless integration of a demanding Windows application
Review.Contenu: Parallels (currently on my macbook pro 2019 with Ventura 13.2.1, running a Windows 10 instance) provides the perfect seamless integration. For many years I was using Oracle Virtual Box to run Windows applications and this worked quite well until I attempted to run PV*SOL by Valentine SW. This software is business critical for me, however it completely failed to work. I simply couldn't use it (much too slow, screens not building up, hanging...). So I tried out Parallels and found the perfect seamless integration imaginable. There is simply not any limitation or disadvantage I could think of. It works as if it was a native Mac Os application (fast as any other application, files on my local Mac Os drive, synched to NextCloud, cut & paste between Mac Os and PV*SOL).Important to mention that my comparison between Virtual Box and Parallels relates to the same laptop (as specified above).

I haven't looked back since.

On top of that, I can use Mac USB peripheral devices, network etc. from the Windows VM as it were implemented on the Windows VM itself.What I like about Parallels is the reliable upgrade policy and the good support.

Review.Contenu: The installation is completely hassle-free. I use the Parallels to run programs that are either Windows only or file conversion to MAC is an ugly process. With Parallels I can have my cake and eat it too.

Review.Titre: LOVE IT!
Review.Contenu: I love the installation is so simple, and no technical skills are required to set up my new M1 Pro Max with Win11 (perfect)!  I highly recommend it and look forward to the latest update and features.

Review.Titre: Parallels for school
Review.Contenu: I used Parallels for school.  We were given VMs created by other programs but they didn't run the best on the Mac.  Converting and importing into Parallels just had the best user experience around.

Review.Titre: I couldn't believe how easy it was...
Review.Contenu: I couldn't believe how easy it was to get up and running with the trial. It very quickly proved to me that it was the only real solution for my use case. Pretty much one touch to get Windows and Linux (e.g. Kali Linux) up and running with very little to configure.  With that such a seamless experience, the two week trial was plenty of time to get it tested.Also, as a bonus, the ability to use Picture in Picture and Coherence mode - it's far ahead of the competition.  If you don't know what these are, it's worth it to read up on it.

Review.Titre: Super simple install of Windows 11…
Review.Contenu: Super simple install of Windows 11 Arm64 on Apple silicon. Excellent graphics performance (3D support), and seamless integration of file systems (i.e. Windows mapped drives to folders in MacOS). I have been a VMware Fusion user for many years and was reluctant to switch but felt that new Apple silicon Processor Unit (APU) forced my hand when Windows 11 was super difficult to install and, even after getting it installed, still complained about audio drivers and had _terrible_ graphics performance. Compared to running Win11 in Parallels with one click and then installing Steam and being able to play the latest 3D games as though they were natively installed on bare metal!My purchase also came with a bunch of extra tools (Parallels Toolbox) and some of them have been useful as well (toolbar overflow, multi-clipboard, etc) but the the "killer app" for me is really just Parallels Desktop.

Review.Titre: Parallels allow me to use PC based…
Review.Contenu: Parallels allow me to use PC based software on my MacBook allowing me to have two computers in one.  It saves me time. If it saves me time, it also saves me money. Paralles allows me to keep all my files on one computer.

Review.Titre: Easy to configure
Review.Contenu: It’s great to be able to have another operating system with Mac, for student and PoCs are really useful. And the user experience with configuration of a shared folder or copy & paste features between both machines is great.

Review.Titre: After 25 years of a Windows PC I got a…
Review.Contenu: After 25 years of a Windows PC I got a MAC because of all the problems related to PC's. But, I mainly use Excel and Word and the numbers and pages on my MAC are not near as user friendly so Parallels helped me to add Excel and Word to my MAC. Now I have the best of both worlds.

Review.Titre: Flexible and fast
Review.Contenu: Main Reason: Stable efficient sharing of mac data with other OSs. Benefits: Everything I would have done on my desktop with OS installed dual boot

Review.Titre: The best virtualisation software by far
Review.Contenu: This is the best virtualisation software by far. I have tried it all. I've used VMware on Linux for a few years and thought that nothing can ever top it. Now when I switched to macOS, I can see how wrong I was. Parallels is truly amazing, everything just works! No more dealing with broken copy&paste and similar issues.This is what a user experience should look like. I just really hope they keep it up.

Review.Titre: From my point of view awesome product.
Review.Contenu: I have to say. There isn’t the smallest flaw with Parallels. Even from very begining M1 chip and Windows 11. I use Windows 11 with Parallels on both Intel and M1 chips mostly In coherence mode. The only problem is software for ARM chips for Windows. Only limited amount.

Review.Titre: Parallels is a great option for Mac
Review.Contenu: For the most part, Windows software works. I use the Windows VM solely for work.  It would be nice to have mainstream Linux options as the current selections are rather limited (i.e. please add Linux Mint Cinnamon).

Review.Titre: Great for gaming!
Review.Contenu: I've bought Parallels to play Helldivers via Steam on Windows 11, running in MacOS Ventura. And the game works great! I've also installed a couple of other games, and I'm glad to be able to run all of them on this Macbook.

Review.Titre: *FAR* better than VMWare Fusion, IMHO...
Review.Contenu: I needed a Windows virtual machine on my Apple Silicon MacBook Pro, because I needed to run Microsoft SQL Server Management Studio on it.  I tried VMWare Fusion first. It worked, but boy was it a chore to install correctly.  Took a couple of hours.  A co-worker of mine tried Parallels, and he had *SUCH* as easier time of it.  Parallels went and found (and installed!) the correct version of Windows 11 Pro (VMWare made me find it, download it, and install it manually).  Further, using Parallels, you can run Windows programs directly on your Mac desktop, right next to Mac programs. They call it "coherence mode," and you can't even tell that the program is a Windows program running in a virtual machine. It looks like a native Mac app!The last straw for me was when VMWare Fusion wouldn't let me copy/paste something from a Mac app to an app running inside its virtual machine window.  Because apparently it just can't do that.  No clue why.  It just can't.  They even say so in their documentation.  So I uninstalled it and switched to Parallels.  That was a bit over a month ago, and I'm not going back.Parallels also offers you the ability to subscribe to the software annually, if you want "free" major-release updates, or you can pay for the software one time, and not get any major-release updates.  I *LIKE* the idea of actually being able to BUY software instead of subscribing to it forever.  Having the option to do either is definitely a plus in my book.

Review.Titre: A seamless way to use Windows on Mac
Review.Contenu: We had a little difficulty installing Parallels -- I can't exactly remember what we had to do to make it work, "we" being my IT help. But once installed, operating Windows on my Macbook is so easy and smooth. There have been no hiccups when operating; you just use it like any other application, opening and closing as needed.I've used a different platform for Windows on Mac before that required to partition disk space restarting the Macbook in the proper platform every time to be used. That was not convenient at all, especially after using something as easy as Parallels!

Review.Titre: Now my Windows ERP runs on my MacBook!
Review.Contenu: My ERP is an old classic windows form application (I think it was done with Visual Fox Pro) but I wanted to use a Mac. With Parallels I solved the problem.

Review.Titre: Almost all games run smoothly :)
Review.Contenu: Almost all games run smoothly :) the integration itself is also very smooth and deep, you feel like you just operate Win apps as if they were Mac ones. Thanks!

Review.Titre: The best option tu run Windows on MAC M1
Review.Contenu: If you are looking for running Windows on your MAC, as other app install in it, Parallels is the best option. It runs as native as possible on my Macbook pro M1, and surprises me with for example, I receive an email with a *.rar extension compressing some files, and one I clic download and clic on it, it just open and verily notice that Windows are open and working, because a pop up appear asking me for some notification permissions. I choose Parallels, because I had to manage some Excel files that cannot be open in Excel Mac native app because some configurations, and now I can open, edit and so much more. About the price, I think it worth it a lot, because I'm no longer seeking for someone to borrow their PC to do some tasks, wasting time during the process.

Review.Titre: Windows 11 via Parallels on an M1 MacMini
Review.Contenu: I've been running Windows 11 via Parallels on an M1 MacMini for about 3 months now. I have had no crash or memory hog problems at all. Simple to setup. Coherence mode is extremely handy too.

Review.Titre: It works
Review.Contenu: It works! It enables me to work on my work Mac with MYOB accounting software not compatible with the current Mac O/S. I would need to change my computer to a PC or change my accounting software. Neither of which I wished to do.

Review.Titre: Does what it is supposed to do
Review.Contenu: Does what it is supposed to do. Need to run sometimes some old programs on Windows after migrating to macOS. Everything is good. Recommend!

Review.Titre: In a word, Fantastic.
Review.Contenu: In a word, fantastic. No muss, no fuss. Setup was quick and painless, and the Windows 11 instance works a treat. The two weeks test period was perfect for me, and the software made my decision to subscribe to the software a very easy one.

Review.Titre: If you need to use Win apps on Mac, Parallels is what you should choose.
Review.Contenu: If you need to use Win apps on Mac, Parallels is what you should choose. Runs smoothly, is optimised, and finaly, its Windows that acts like Mac OS, kind of. I highly recommend Parallels. I am using it daily and could not ask for more. Thank you and keep up the good work.

Review.Contenu: Its absolutely perfect Product runs smoothly on MacBook Pro M1. Also runs Windows11 and Linux Debian…and their apps. So far all good. Highly recommend

Review.Contenu: I had used VMWare previously and could not get it working this time with Win11. Parallels was very easy to use. It downloaded Win 11 very easily & quickly. I run this on a MacBook Pro because there are some programs that I use that are not available for Mac. Yes, I would use again.

Review.Titre: I have used Parallels for many years
Review.Contenu: I have used Parallels for many years.  It has seamlessly supported my needs on a mac and a windows computer.  Without Parallels I would have to work on 2 computers.  It is life changing for me.

Review.Contenu: Parallels deals with the challenges of running Windows-based applications on a Mac.  It works great with the M1 Pro CPU.  So fast and seamless.

Review.Titre: Thanks to Parallels' snapshot feature
Review.Contenu: Thanks to Parallels' snapshot feature, when something went wrong with Windows, I was able to immediately restore the system and get back to work. This is a really necessary feature for me.

Review.Contenu: Our Drupal development system uses Vagrant and Ansible to provision virtual Linux servers with Parallels. Occasionally I use Windows to test our website on. Over perhaps a decade Parallels has been reliable and well documented in the different roles it has served us.

Review.Contenu: The software is easy to install, simple to operate, and reliable. Tech support is readily available and in my experience my tech reps have been willing to go above and beyond what is required to insure my satisfaction. Solid software, solid support.

Review.Contenu: Parallels is a really good application. You can almost do everything, including gaming working and so many other things. It's efficient and fast.

Review.Contenu: I really love USB devices running on Windows11 under Parallels. No problems found.The speed with M1 architecture is really impressive.

Review.Contenu: I tried Parallels years ago, and the surprise has been great, much more integrated and faster.

Review.Contenu: We use it more for video downloads. Excellent product does a fantastic job at whatever we require.Thank you,Allan D.

Review.Contenu: I love using Parallels. I can have my Windows window and Mac window side by side.
